artist: Kara Walker; Printer: Landfall Press, Santa Fe, N.M. (formerly Chicago); Publisher: Landfall Press, Santa Fe, N.M. (formerly Chicago)
provenance: Landfall Press, Chicago (now Santa Fe, N.M.), publisher; Private collection; (William Shearburn Gallery, St. Louis, Mo.); sold to MIA, 2009.
signed: at bottom of sheet, in pencil: (c)  African/American  KW
text: Kara Walker began working in the 1990s in an obsolete artistic medium, the cut-paper silhouette, which she radically transformed into a potent language to explore issues in American history and society, mainly related to slavery, violence, and sexual exploitation. In African/American, made as a printed silhouette, Walker depicted the solitary nude figure of a female African American slave tumbling down through midair. The image is at once elegant and disturbing: elegant in form and compositional harmony yet disturbing in its dark and foreboding content.
title: African/American
